name: thoracic vessel atherosclerotic calcification
description: A disease characterized by the deposition of calcified and non-calcified plaques on the inner walls of the arteries in the chest area

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: The anatomical region of the atherosclerosis

values.name: aortic arch
values.description: The top part of the main artery carrying blood away from the heart

values.name: descending thoracic aorta
values.description: The part of the aorta that travels down through the chest

values.name: ascending thoracic aorta
values.description: The part of the aorta that travels up through the chest

values.name: thoracic aortic and great vessels
values.description: The part of the aorta that travels through the chest and the great vessels that branch off of it

values.name: thoracic aorta
values.description: The part of the aorta that travels through the chest

examples.report_text: Atherosclerosis of the thoracic aorta. Cardiomegaly. Severe amount of coronary calcifications.

Mediastinum: Atherosclerotic calcification of the aorta and major aortic branch vessels. Calcification again demonstrated at the aortic arch. Vascular evaluation limited in the absence of intravenous contrast. Similar ectasia of the ascending
